text: I'm starting to familiarize myself with the Trapit API. Does anyone know where I might find the "org_slug" referenced in their docs? <http://trapit.github.io/documentation/?#/Getting-Started-Public>
I can reach out Ethan and trapit and ask

I don’t know the url base or the slug. If I’m remembering correctly from the kickoff meeting, OMSI has already set up a trapit account with some traps, so it should only be a matter of retrieving that info from them if we haven’t already.
is omsi's account if that helps. login info: user/ <mailto:karen@uncorkedstudios.com|karen@uncorkedstudios.com>, pass/ trapitKO
that covers the url base, but not the slug. I checked around the dashboard for it, but didn't find any clues.
let me know what you need and i can email ethan at trapit for ya. he'll get you what you need.
is it the thing that gets appended to the url
where do we go to login to a trapit account?
it will redirect you to <http://omsi.trap.it/curate/|omsi.trap.it/curate/> but <http://omsi.trap.it|omsi.trap.it> is sufficient
our api url will be <https://omsi.trap.it/api/v4/{org_slug}/public-traps/> but we'll have to get the org_slug from someone--I'm assuming Ethan is our best bet

According to the doc "All Trapit clients using public traps will receive a custom, organization specific URL base and org_slug". So maybe it's buried in whatever activation email was sent when the account was originally set up?
